pages.text: You have successfully obtained the Spell Core of the $(#DA70D6)Form$()Spell. Now we can learn how to use the $(#DA70D6)Form$()Spell Core and the $(#DA70D6)Form$()Spell. You may have already encountered magick that is released through touch or projectiles, but these types of magick have limited structures and cannot target multiple entities simultaneously. Therefore, we also need the Radiant type of the $(#DA70D6)Form$()Spell to help us select targets within a certain range.

Square Radiant is one type of Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$(), which allows us to target entities or blocks within a certain range. However, once the Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$() triggers its function, it will disappear immediately regardless of its duration. So, how do we use it?

We need to understand that any $(#DA70D6)Form$()Spell can pass on direction and position. The passed-on function and position can be used not only by $(#0000FF)Function$() Spells but also by $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spells. When we use the Spirit Bow to generate mana arrows, they can only damage a single target. However, when we apply the Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$() to the Spirit Bow, it will generate the Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$() after the mana arrow hits the target. Thus, we can utilize the Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$() to trigger $(#0000FF)Function$() Spells on multiple targets.

pages.title: Spherical Radiant Molding Spell
pages.text: This Molding Spell utilizes Square Radiant to trigger a debuff effect. When triggered, it generates a square area where all entities within it will receive the debuff effect of Arc magic. The entire process of attaching it to the Spirit Bow is as follows:$(br)(1) -> Release the mana arrow with the $(#DA70D6)Form$() of the Molding Spell.$(br)(2) -> The mana arrow with the $(#DA70D6)Form$() touches the target and generates the Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$().$(br)(3) -> The Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$() triggers the $(#0000FF)Function$() Spell.

Now we need to throw the Spell Core of the $(#DA70D6)Form$()Spell on the ground, and it will unfold a structure similar to the $(#0000FF)Function$() Spell Core. It can also absorb mana materials. For general $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spells, the duration is necessary as it determines how long the $(#DA70D6)Form$() can exist in the world. Therefore, we need to use Redstone-converted duration mana energy. Just like when constructing $(#0000FF)Function$() Spells, you can throw the materials into it.

The $(#00CED1)force$() and $(#EE6363)Range$() of the $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spell are not necessary. Whether to increase the $(#00CED1)force$() and $(#EE6363)Range$() of the $(#DA70D6)Form$() depends on the characteristics of the $(#DA70D6)Form$() itself. For example, projectile $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spells do not require $(#EE6363)Range$(), usually only increasing the duration is enough. However, Radiant-type $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spells usually require a larger $(#EE6363)Range$() attribute to target more entities. Of course, higher $(#EE6363)Range$() also means higher mana consumption. projectile $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spells have special Needs for magical elements and can be thrown into Elemental Cores, which will be explained in subsequent chapters.

The construction of $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spells also requires using the wand's right-click to obtain the Molding Spell. The Molding Spell you obtained should be similar to this one. However, having only the Radiant $(#DA70D6)Form$() Spell is not enough; we also need to remove the previously created $(#0000FF)Function$() Spell and combine these two Molding Spells together.
